Description: Articles were explicitly motivated by some aspect of gender and organized their research and argument around this concern.
Articles mentioned something relevant to the study of gender and sexuality in the abstract, but unclear whether the full research article maintained a theoretical focus on this dimension.
No explicit relevance to or focus on gender-related issues.
Book reviews, literature reviews, bibliographies, critical responses to or fora on existing published work, introductions to special issues of journals, and personal reflections.
